title: IIT Guwahati, HDFC Parivartan power sustainability push in Northeast India
desc: IIT Guwahati, in collaboration with HDFC Parivartan, is implementing technology-driven interventions in Assam and Meghalaya to enhance food and energy security. The project focuses on biomass pellet production, agrivoltaics farming, tea processing, and freeze-drying facilities. These initiatives aim to empower farmers, promote sustainable agribusiness models, and boost the rural economy.

title: China says in working level communication with US over tariff war
desc: Amidst a high-stakes tariff war, China and the US are in communication at working levels, addressing trade imbalances. Beijing insists the US, having initiated the tariffs, should resolve the dispute through respectful dialogue, urging an end to pressure tactics.

title: Germany sees 'worrying' record dry spell in early 2025
desc: Germany's environment minister has issued a warning about the heightened risk of forest fires and potential harvest failures due to a significant lack of rainfall. The country experienced its driest period since 1931, with rainfall levels far below the average, particularly impacting northwest and southeast regions.

title: Opportunities at a macro level: 5 stocks of companies which help in managing a scarce resource called ‘water’
desc: Big wealth creation does not happen in already well-discovered, well-researched sectors. It happens in sectors that are not in the news, not much-talked-about on the street. Sectors where macro changes are taking place and overall demand is on the rise. In the last few years, both due to policy pushes and changes in the underlying nature of the business, more money is being spent on increasing agricultural productivity. Now, agriculture is a sector where things do not change overnight. But once change happens, it creates a demand which is very strong and lasts for a long time.

title: Trump says China 'reneged' on Boeing deal as tensions flare
desc: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday that China has gone back on a major Boeing deal, after a news report that Beijing ordered airlines not to take further deliveries of the US aviation giant's jets. Trump took aim at Beijing again on Tuesday, saying on Truth Social that China did not fully fulfil an earlier trade deal.

title: SOPA urges delay on soybean stock sale to protect prices ahead of kharif sowing
desc: The Soybean Processors Association of India (SOPA) has urged the Union Agriculture Ministry to further delay the sale of soybean stocks by NAFED and NCCF until after the kharif sowing season concludes. SOPA fears that releasing the stock prematurely will depress prices, harming farmers and causing losses for the government, reversing the positive price movement seen after the initial postponement.

title: India's organic product exports up 34.6 pc in 2024-25 to USD 665.96 mn in 2024-25
desc: India's organic product exports witnessed a significant surge, climbing by 34.6% to reach USD 665.96 million in 2024-25, driven by heightened demand for pulses, essential oils, and fresh produce in developed nations. This growth is supported by a 4% increase in volume, totaling 368,155 tonnes. APEDA's revised NPOP regulations aim to further boost exports, targeting USD 2 billion by 2030.

title: Delhi govt approves 3-month extension of EV policy, continues power subsidy
desc: The Delhi government has extended its Electric Vehicle (EV) policy for three months and will continue providing power subsidies to domestic consumers, farmers, lawyers, and 1984 riot victims. Transport Minister Pankaj Singh clarified that there will be no ban on autos or any other vehicle category.

title: Andhra Pradesh mulls pooling 30,000 more acres for Amaravati; no decision yet: Minister
desc: The Andhra Pradesh government is contemplating acquiring 30,000 acres around Amaravati via land pooling to develop a mega city, complete with an international airport. While no final decision has been made, Chief Minister Naidu is eager to integrate nearby areas. Reconstruction in Amaravati has commenced, with tenders finalized for numerous projects and a timeline set for completion of key infrastructure.

title: India to receive above normal rainfall in 2025 with neutral El Nino conditions, IMD says
desc: India is expected to receive above-average monsoon rains in 2025, according to the India Meteorological Department. The monsoon is projected to be 105% of the long-term average, potentially boosting the agricultural sector. While most of the country will experience above-normal rainfall, some regions in Northwest, Northeast, and South Peninsular India may receive below-normal rainfall.

title: Farming meets the future: This AI-powered app equips farmers for a changing climate
desc: Farmers using Digital Green’s Farmer.Chat app receive valuable insights on pest and disease outbreaks, weather updates, and market access.

title: India harvests 38% of wheat area so far in 2025–26 season, says agriculture minister Chouhan
desc: India has harvested 38% of its estimated 32 million hectares of wheat for the 2025-26 marketing season, according to Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan. Harvesting conditions are reportedly favorable across key wheat-producing states. The government has set a procurement target of 31 million metric tons of wheat for this season.

title: Around 80 pc of Maharashtra farmers will get free power by Dec next year: Devendra Fadnavis
desc: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced that approximately 80% of farmers in the state will receive free electricity by December 2026. This initiative aims to provide 12 hours of daytime electricity throughout the year, offering significant relief to the agricultural community. The government is actively working on generating 16000 MW of electricity under the Mukhyamantri Saur Krishi Yojana.

title: Farmers' meeting to be held on May 8 in Prayagraj on land acquisition issue: Rakesh Tikait
desc: Rakesh Tikait announced a farmers' meeting in Prayagraj on May 8 to address alleged land acquisition irregularities, highlighting it as a nationwide issue where land is purportedly being seized through conspiracies. He criticized the biased land measurement process favoring businessmen and lamented the deteriorating law and order in Uttar Pradesh, citing recent murders and promising to support the victims' families.

title: Duty amid despair: Unseen sacrifice of India's Agromet workers fighting climate chaos
desc: Despite the government's order to shut down 199 District Agrometeorological Units (DAMUs) in January 2024, around 130 employees continued their work unpaid, driven by their commitment to farmers. These employees secured a court stay and persevered, assisting farmers through challenging weather conditions. After a year of sacrifice, their salaries were finally released following court intervention on March 31.

title: Tariffied shrimp exporters look beyond US shores
desc: India's shrimp export industry, heavily reliant on the US market, is strategizing to diversify risks. Following a tariff ease by the US, the industry is urging the government to promote domestic shrimp consumption and negotiate a free trade agreement with Europe.

title: Punjab National Bank launches 34 new products on its 131st foundation day
desc: Punjab National Bank celebrated its 131st foundation day by launching 34 new products, including customer-centric deposit schemes and digital transformation initiatives. Financial Services Secretary M Nagaraju commended PNB's efforts to deepen financial inclusion and enhance customer experience. The bank also organized a 'Cyber Run' to promote cybersecurity awareness and safe digital banking practices.

title: Time for India’s agri-exporters to look beyond US to mitigate Trump’s tariffs, say experts, stakeholders
desc: Diversification into new markets and value-added products, along with infrastructure upgrades and support for MSMEs, are crucial for mitigating the impact and ensuring long-term competitiveness.

title: Daylight savings 2025: Donald Trump wants to stop moving clocks back one hour every autumn, cites THIS reason
desc: Daylight Saving Time was adopted by the federal government during World War I but was unpopular with farmers rushing to get produce to morning markets, and was quickly abolished.

title: Tariffs impact? Texas famers to immediately receive water from Mexico under over 80-year-old water sharing treaty, day after Donald Trump issued threat
desc: Mexico, which has fallen short on it deliveries under an 81-year-old water sharing treaty with the U.S.

title: After China, Trump threatens sanctions, tariffs on Mexico for 'stealing water'
desc: Donald Trump has threatened Mexico with sanctions and tariffs, accusing them of violating a 1944 water treaty and depriving Texas farmers of water. Mexico owes Texas 1.3 million acre-feet of water, but President Claudia Sheinbaum claims compliance is limited by drought. Mexico is scrambling to increase water deliveries amid concerns Trump could involve the dispute in trade negotiations.

title: Trump touts 'self-deport' campaign for migrants
desc: Donald Trump's administration unveils a self-deportation program. It encourages undocumented migrants to leave the US voluntarily. The goal is to facilitate their legal return later. A new app, CBP Home, aids this process. The government collaborates with El Salvador, Colombia, and Mexico. They will provide support to returning migrants. Farmers and hotels will get temporary migrant workers.

title: Pay Commission math doesn't work
desc: "Historically, pay commission recommendations have led to a fitment factor of around 2.8, implying that salaries could rise nearly 3x. To pre-empt accusations of bias, comparisons are often made between incomes of lower-grade gov employees and those of farmers."

title: MrBeast criticises Trump tariffs, highlights impact on his chocolate brand Feastables
desc: Feastables is currently produced in both Peru and the US, but the company sources its cocoa internationally and ensures fair pay for farmers. “We pay our farmers a living income, use fair trade certified beans, etc. so I was already spending a lot on cocoa,” he said. “A random price hike was pretty brutal ngl.”

title: Congress passes seven-point resolution on Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
desc: The Congress Working Committee, convening at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Memorial, has resolved to emulate Patel's principles. The resolution highlights the differences between the BJP's policies and Patel's ideals, particularly concerning farmers' rights. Congress accuses the BJP government of mirroring oppressive British tactics against farmers and pledges to follow Patel's path of advocating for their rights.

title: Agritech startup AgroStar raises $6.7 million from Accel India, other existing backers
desc: Founded in 2013 by Sitanshu Sheth and Shardul Sheth, Pune-based AgroStar leverages data and technology to provide good quality agri-inputs to farmers and bridge the knowledge gap in farming practices. The company board has passed a resolution to issue 1,45,385 compulsory convertible non-cumulative preference shares at Rs 3,965 each, to raise Rs 57.6 crore, as per filings sourced from business intelligence platform Tofler.

title: Donald Trump's core voter base may be the first to benefit as President urgently plans farmer bailout amid tariffs fallout
desc: American farmers are facing losses due to global retaliatory tariffs. The Trump administration plans a relief package for them to counteract the impact. Retaliatory tariffs from countries like China and Canada have led to reduced U.S. agricultural exports and lower crop prices. The administration is working with lawmakers to arrange funding for long-term damage.

title: Stir to go on till demands met, farmer leaders to attend May 4 talks with Centre: Dallewal
desc: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal stated that the farmers' agitation will persist until the government concedes to their demands, including a legal MSP guarantee. Despite security challenges, farmers are determined to press their demands in the proposed May 4 talks with the Centre. 'Kisan Mahapanchayats' are being organized across Punjab to sustain the momentum.

title: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal ends his indefinite hunger strike
desc: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal ended his indefinite fast, initiated on November 26 to demand a legal guarantee on the minimum support price for crops, following appeals from Union Ministers. The decision was announced at a 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' after ministers advocated for his health and proposed further discussions.
